comments.body: It looks like properties totalCount, idleCount, waitingCount are missing, see https://node-postgres.com/api/pool#-code-pool-totalcount-int-code-
Added. But there may still be some other missing properties or methods, since the purpose of this PR is to fix definition error rather then make it complete.
poolSize is also allowed as an alias for max
But is it documented? I can't find it from document and example.

Ah you're right I think I only saw it in the code.
Perhaps we rather avoid to add it, and sticks to max only which is the 'official' property since 7.0
Could you back up version 6 to another folder as decsribed in the [readme](https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped#i-want-to-update-a-package-to-a-new-major-version)?
I have copied the files prior to my change to folder `v6`.
Do you want to use the new TypeScript arg features for this? `any` seems dangerous here.

Not sure I understand the suggestion. I just followed (copied) the existing definition of `query(queryTextOrConfig: string | QueryConfig, values?: any[]): Promise<QueryResult>`

BTW, according to code, 'values' can either be a _function_ or an _array_ of values of _any_ type. We can define values param as: function | any[], not sure if this will be correct.

'statement_timeout' default is 'false', meaning 'unlimited'; see here: 

- https://github.com/brianc/node-postgres/blob/1cbd507b8ca0416b9be0252cc930762e716ba60f/lib/connection-parameters.js#L67
- https://github.com/brianc/node-postgres/blob/1cbd507b8ca0416b9be0252cc930762e716ba60f/lib/defaults.js#L58

'true' has no meaning, and number is anything which is not 'unlimited'.
Do you want to review PRs?

I really like this approach, but I believe this breaks userland interfaces that *extend* `ConnectionConfig`. I don't know if this is an actual problem or if this is 'niche' enough to be safely changed, either way I don't think I'm the right person to decide that.
Are there DT guidelines for these kind of situations?

Extending types seems to work, at least in the newest TS versions https://www.typescriptlang.org/play/index.html?ssl=1&ssc=1&pln=12&pc=2#code/C4TwDgpgBAglC8UDeAoK6oEMBcUB2ArgLYBGEATgNwoC+KKAlnsBQGaYDG0AQlBAB4s8AEwDOsZGgwlco4OSYBzanRQcA9njlQAbpgWYSAGwi5eiVBiy4ATAGYALABop6GVADko4aw+0gA
What are the problems you aware of?
I guess I was wrong then, perhaps it was changed in a recent version.
